column4: How do I switch between KDM and Gnome? I had to install kdm to get past my login screen (faulty login screen theme), so what is the terminal command to switch?
on the password screen change your session
is there a command though?
sue there are 2 links there.. the second one describes how to do it.. there is no single command
sorry, where are the links?
sue above. in ubottu's post
sorry, your not making sense, I don't see any messages from ubottu.
:P
!ipv6 | sue
sue .. now do you see it?
yes, but what does that have to do with KDM and Gnome?
please read the link.. it has to do with ubuntu, kubuntu, xubuntu, linux etc.. gnome & kde don't have anything to do with it.
so, If I want to switch between KDM and gnome, then why do I have to look at something about  "IPv4 and IPV6" connections??     I'm sorry, I guess I'll just ask someone else.

My appologies.. I went back and saw where I got confused.. I was responding to the wrong nick with the wrong info.. sorry for the frustration.. on the login screen where you put your password there should be an Options button where you can change from gnome to kde
That's fine, I was beginning to think you where crazy!
sue.. :)
kitche has the name right.. it's called sessions. in options
Ok, the only problem is, my Gnome login window theme is faulty...So I need someway to change it without logging out.
I'm afraid I'm going to defer that question to someone that knows the answer.. sorry I don't
No problem, thank you very much for your help!
